key_entities.name: Rumeli Hisarı
key_entities.role: Choked off the Bosphorus; starved the city of grain from the Black Sea.
key_entities.detail: Built in four and a half months. Strategic noose before the first cannon fired.

key_entities.name: Orban / Basilica
key_entities.role: Hungarian engineer; built the great cannon 'Basilica'.
key_entities.detail: Monstrous cannon firing 1,500 lb stones. Designed to break the unbreakable walls.

key_entities.name: Golden Horn chain
key_entities.role: Romans blocked the Golden Horn to keep the Turkish fleet out.
key_entities.detail: Massive chain; forced Mehmed to find another way (overland ships).

key_entities.name: Overland ships
key_entities.role: Ottoman galleys dragged over hills on greased logs into the Golden Horn.
key_entities.detail: Bypassed the chain; dropped ships behind Roman defences. Masterstroke.

key_entities.name: Kerkoporta
key_entities.role: Small gate left unlocked; Ottoman troops slipped behind the walls.
key_entities.detail: Coincided with Giustiniani wounded; breach became rout.

key_entities.name: Constantine XI exit
key_entities.role: Emperor threw off imperial purple, drew sword, charged into the fray.
key_entities.detail: Died with his city. Duygu Adamı—chose the door out with dignity.

key_entities.name: Kayser-i Rûm
key_entities.role: Mehmed II declared himself Caesar of Rome.
key_entities.detail: Ottoman Empire as true successor to Roman legacy. Hagia Sophia to mosque; city kept as capital.

heritage_philosophy.değirmen: The Mill grinding down an old power to make room for the new. Byzantines held the handle 1,100 years; in 1453 the clock struck midnight.
heritage_philosophy.aşk_olsun: Honour to the one who turns the mill—Orban, the overland ships, the Janissaries in the breach.
heritage_philosophy.duygu_adamı: Constantine XI chose the door out with dignity. Fought and died with his city.
heritage_philosophy.felsefe_bu: The walls that stood for a millennium met a man who refused to believe in impossible.
